page.title: 02FARM LIFE in Blindcrake
page.content: A typical day begins at 5.45am with milking, repeated again at 4pm. After breakfast the other stock is fed and checked. The rest of the day varies according to the season. {Spring.} Sheep are lambing. The land is ploughed and sown with barley, turnips and some potatoes and veget- ables for household use. { { Summer.}Grass is cut and made into hay or silage followed by the harvesting of barley. { Autumn.}Turnips and other root crops are lifted and cattle housed indoors. {Winter.}The day is taken up with care of the animals and protecting everything from the elements. Other tasks throughout the year are: dosing cattle and sheep, dipping and clipping sheep, hedging, dyking and spreading muck and manure.
